title: parameters_data
text: PARAMETER_TYPE Parameter type divided five classifications two “wastebasket” categories. classification requires degree subjective judgement. makes chemical stressor versus quality parameter always clear. However, anticipate cases uncontroversial. case stressors can still identified name/id. "relevant" - Use type applicable measured scalar. "Stressor" - hemical, physical biological agent causing stress. "Quality parameter" - Standard water/environmental quality parameter "Normalisation" - Parameter used normalising measurements"Background" - “Natural background level parameter”"Ecological Indicator" - Parameter indicator metric ecological concern. "" - Parameter belongs another category

title: parameters_data
text: "relevant" - Use type applicable measured scalar. "Stressor" - hemical, physical biological agent causing stress. "Quality parameter" - Standard water/environmental quality parameter "Normalisation" - Parameter used normalising measurements"Background" - “Natural background level parameter”"Ecological Indicator" - Parameter indicator metric ecological concern. "" - Parameter belongs another category

what: Data reporting format for STOP's exposure data format
title: Data reporting format for STOP's exposure data format
text: eData Data Reporting Format format standardisation data pollutant occurence environment. converting data single, consistent format, makes easier validate, compare, analyse, reuse, line FAIR principles data typically published concentrations (water) mass ratios (soil, sludge biota). Fully interpreting measurements requires considerable metadata, relating time, place, conditions, methodology, context sampling. However, single standard exists metadata, study authors sampling teams tend use variety inconsistent definitions, units, schema depending scientific domain study’s individual needs. , problem. However, environmental risk assessment becomes data-based larger scale, need use re-use large quantities data increases. datasets consistent, validated, interoperable, much time can saved. , researchers much go tedious process understanding, validating remapping hand; often non-reproducible process. Thus harmonised format - associated validation formatting functions - can represent significant timesaver anyone position. format (first) attempt address issue. Rather attempt perfect format covers relevant domains, elected focus pollutants water, aquatic biota, similar compartments (sludge, aquatic sediment, etc.). Caveats Links Vignettes

what: CREED assessment scores controlled vocabulary — CREED_choices_vocabulary
title: CREED assessment scores controlled vocabulary — CREED_choices_vocabulary
text: Returns standardised scoring options CREED data quality assessment.

title: CREED assessment scores controlled vocabulary — CREED_choices_vocabulary
CREED assessment scores controlled vocabulary — CREED_choices_vocabulary
text: Named character vector CREED scoring choices numeric values

title: CREED assessment scores controlled vocabulary — CREED_choices_vocabulary
text: Provides four-level scoring system used CREED (Criteria Reporting Evaluating Ecotoxicity Data) assessments. Options include: Met: Score value 4 Fully Met: Score value 1 Partly Met: Score value 2 Reported: Score value 3 Relevant: Score value 1

what: Abbreviate string to first n words with case formatting — abbreviate_string
title: Abbreviate string to first n words with case formatting — abbreviate_string
text: Takes string, extracts first n words (removing special characters), formats according specified case style.

title: Abbreviate string to first n words with case formatting — abbreviate_string
Abbreviate string to first n words with case formatting — abbreviate_string
text: string Character. input string abbreviate. n_words Integer. Number words include abbreviation. case Character. Case style output. One : "lower" - lowercase, separator (e.g., "dogsandcats") "upper" - uppercase, separator (e.g., "DOGSANDCATS") "sentence" - sentence case, separator (e.g., "Dogsandcats") "snake" - lowercase underscores (e.g., "dogs_and_cats") "title" - title case, separator (e.g., "DogsAndCats") "screamingsnake" - uppercase underscores (e.g., "DOGS_AND_CATS") "camel" - camel case (e.g., "dogsAndCats")

title: Abbreviate string to first n words with case formatting — abbreviate_string
text: Character. abbreviated formatted string.

title: Abbreviate string to first n words with case formatting — abbreviate_string
code: abbreviate_string("Total Phosphorus Concentration", n_words = 2L, "snake") #> [1] "total_phosphorus" abbreviate_string("dogs and cats", n_words = 3L, "title") #> [1] "DogsAndCats" abbreviate_string("Water Quality Index", n_words = 3L, "camel") #> [1] "waterQualityIndex"

title: Analytical protocols controlled vocabulary — analytical_protocols_vocabulary
text: Provides standardised analytical method classifications tibble three columns: Protocol_Type: Always "Analytical Protocol" Short_Name: Abbreviated protocol name (e.g., "GC-MS", "LC-MS/MS", "ICP-MS") Long_Name: Full descriptive name (e.g., "Gas chromatography mass spectrometry", "Liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry", "Inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry") Available protocols include: relevant, reported, GC-MS, LC-MS, LC-MS/MS, GC-MS/MS, UPLC, ICP-MS, ICP-OES, AAS, XRF, Ion chromatography, Spectrophotometry, Fluorescence,

Data source: extdata/IHO_oceans.rds

title: Dummy parameters controlled vocabulary — dummy_parameters_vocabulary

Quality parameters read dummy_quality_parameters.parquet chemical parameters ClassyFire_Taxonomy_2025_02.parquet. resulting dataset includes columns parameter classification, chemical identifiers (InChIKey, PubChem CID, CAS RN), measurement types. Note: Quality parameters currently "dummy" data comprehensive validated list yet compiled. Data sources: extdata/dummy_quality_parameters.parquet extdata/ClassyFire_Taxonomy_2025_02.parquet

what: Export Multiple Datasets as ZIP of CSV Files — export_campaign_zip
title: Export Multiple Datasets as ZIP of CSV Files — export_campaign_zip
text: Creates ZIP archive containing CSV files non-empty dataset provided list. Useful bundling campaign data download archival.

title: Export Multiple Datasets as ZIP of CSV Files — export_campaign_zip
Export Multiple Datasets as ZIP of CSV Files — export_campaign_zip
text: dataset_list Named list tibbles/data.frames export. Names match expected dataset names (e.g., "edata_sites", "edata_measurements"). Empty datasets (NULL, 0 rows) automatically filtered . campaign_name Character. Campaign identifier used ZIP filename individual CSV filenames. Special characters replaced underscores. Default "Unknown_Campaign". output_path Character. Full path ZIP file saved. NULL (default), saves current working directory auto-generated name.

title: Export Multiple Datasets as ZIP of CSV Files — export_campaign_zip
text: Character. Path created ZIP file (returned invisibly).

title: Export Multiple Datasets as ZIP of CSV Files — export_campaign_zip
text: function: Filters empty NULL datasets Creates timestamped filenames reproducibility Writes CSVs Excel-compatible encoding Cleans temporary files automatically Provides progress messages export ZIP filename format: {campaign_name}_{timestamp}.zip CSV filename format: {campaign_name}_{dataset_name}_{timestamp}.csv

title: Export Multiple Datasets as ZIP of CSV Files — export_campaign_zip
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create sample datasets my_data <- list(   edata_sites = tibble(SITE_CODE = "S01", SITE_NAME = "Site 1"),   edata_measurements = tibble(VALUE = c(1.2, 3.4)) )  # Export to ZIP zip_path <- export_campaign_zip(my_data, "MyStudy2024")  # Export to specific location export_campaign_zip(my_data, "MyStudy", "~/Downloads/export.zip") } # }

what: Generate a semi-unique string ID for a protocol based on its type, name, the campaign name, and a sequence number — generate_protocol_id
title: Generate a semi-unique string ID for a protocol based on its type, name, the campaign name, and a sequence number — generate_protocol_id
text: Generates standardised protocol identifier based protocol type, name, sequence number, campaign. function fully vectorised can handle multiple protocols simultaneously.

title: Generate a semi-unique string ID for a protocol based on its type, name, the campaign name, and a sequence number — generate_protocol_id
Generate a semi-unique string ID for a protocol based on its type, name, the campaign name, and a sequence number — generate_protocol_id
text: protocol_type Character vector. category protocol (e.g., "Sampling Protocol", "Analytical Protocol"). Must match one predefined categories default "X". protocol_name Character vector. specific name/method within protocol category. abbreviated cleaned ID generation. sequence_number Numeric vector. Sequential number protocols within category. Defaults 1. zero-padded 2 digits. campaign_name Character vector. Name campaign/study. abbreviated first 10 alphanumeric characters. Defaults "".

title: Generate a semi-unique string ID for a protocol based on its type, name, the campaign name, and a sequence number — generate_protocol_id
text: Character vector protocol IDs format: TypeCodeSequenceNumber_AbbreviatedName_CampaignAbbrev : TypeCode: S (Sampling), F (Fractionation), E (Extraction), (Analytical), X (Unknown) SequenceNumber: Zero-padded 2-digit number AbbreviatedName: 15 alphanumeric characters (optional) CampaignAbbrev: 10 alphanumeric characters (optional)

title: Generate a semi-unique string ID for a protocol based on its type, name, the campaign name, and a sequence number — generate_protocol_id
text: function handles edge cases gracefully: NULL empty values result appropriate defaults Invalid protocol types default "X" Names cleaned special characters spaces Empty components omitted final ID

title: Generate a semi-unique string ID for a protocol based on its type, name, the campaign name, and a sequence number — generate_protocol_id
code: # Single protocol generate_protocol_id("Sampling Protocol", "Water Sample", 1, "MyStudy") #> [1] "S01_WaterSample_MyStudy" # Returns: "S01_WaterSample_MyStudy"  # Multiple protocols (vectorised) types <- c("Sampling Protocol", "Analytical Protocol") names <- c("Water Sample", "LC-MS Analysis") sequences <- c(1, 2) generate_protocol_id(types, names, sequences, "Study2024") #> [1] "S01_WaterSample_Study2024"  "A02_LcmsAnalysis_Study2024" # Returns: c("S01_WaterSample_Study2024", "A02_LCMSAnalysis_Study2024")

title: Generate Reference ID — generate_reference_id
text: Character string format DateAuthorFirstThreeWords

what: Initialise CREED criteria data tibble — initialise_CREED_data_tibble
title: Initialise CREED criteria data tibble — initialise_CREED_data_tibble
text: Creates empty tibble standardised column structure detailed CREED criterion assessment data.

title: Initialise CREED criteria data tibble — initialise_CREED_data_tibble
Initialise CREED criteria data tibble — initialise_CREED_data_tibble
text: tibble 0 rows standardised CREED criterion columns

title: Initialise CREED criteria data tibble — initialise_CREED_data_tibble
text: CREED criteria data stores individual criterion scores, relevant data, limitations reliability relevance assessments. structure used internally assessment modules part externally-available table structure. tibble includes following columns: criterion_id: Unique identifier CREED criterion criterion_title: Descriptive title criterion required_recommended: Whether criterion required recommended relevant_data: Data information relevant assessing criterion score: Assessment score criterion limitations: Identified limitations concerns criterion

title: Initialise CREED scores tibble — initialise_CREED_scores_tibble
text: Creates empty tibble standardised column structure CREED final scores.

title: Initialise CREED scores tibble — initialise_CREED_scores_tibble
text: tibble 0 rows standardised CREED columns

title: Initialise CREED scores tibble — initialise_CREED_scores_tibble
text: CREED scores provide data quality assessment results references, evaluating reliability relevance silver gold standard levels. tibble includes following columns: REFERENCE_ID: Unique identifier linking references table SILVER_RELIABILITY: Reliability score silver standard level SILVER_RELEVANCE: Relevance score silver standard level GOLD_RELIABILITY: Reliability score gold standard level GOLD_RELEVANCE: Relevance score gold standard level

title: Initialise biota tibble — initialise_biota_tibble
text: Creates empty tibble standardised column structure biota data.

title: Initialise biota tibble — initialise_biota_tibble
text: tibble 0 rows standardised biota columns

title: Initialise biota tibble — initialise_biota_tibble
text: Biota data extends sample information species-specific details including taxonomic classification, tissue type, life stage, gender information. tibble includes following columns: SAMPLE_ID: Unique identifier linking samples table (mandatory, foreign key measurements) SITE_CODE: Code identifying sampling location (mandatory, foreign key sites) PARAMETER_NAME: Name measured parameter stressor (mandatory, foreign key parameters) ENVIRON_COMPARTMENT: Broad environmental compartment category (mandatory, inherited samples) ENVIRON_COMPARTMENT_SUB: Specific sub-category environmental compartment (mandatory, inherited samples) MEASURED_CATEGORY: Category indicating measurement context (mandatory, inherited samples) SAMPLING_DATE: Date biological sample collected (mandatory, inherited samples) SUBSAMPLE: Identifier subsample replicate (mandatory, inherited samples) SPECIES_GROUP: Taxonomic group classification, e.g., Fish, Molluscs, Plants (mandatory) SAMPLE_SPECIES: Scientific binomial name sampled species (mandatory) SAMPLE_TISSUE: Type biological tissue sampled (mandatory) SAMPLE_SPECIES_LIFESTAGE: Life stage organism sampling (mandatory) SAMPLE_SPECIES_GENDER: Gender sex sampled organism (mandatory) BIOTA_COMMENT: Additional notes comments biological sample (optional)

title: Initialise campaign tibble — initialise_campaign_tibble
text: Creates empty tibble standardised column structure campaign data.

title: Initialise campaign tibble — initialise_campaign_tibble
text: tibble 0 rows standardised campaign columns

title: Initialise campaign tibble — initialise_campaign_tibble
text: Campaigns represent sampling projects studies metadata timing, organisation, data quality evaluation, confidentiality. tibble includes following columns: CAMPAIGN_NAME_SHORT: Short identifier campaign (mandatory) CAMPAIGN_NAME: Full descriptive name campaign (mandatory) CAMPAIGN_START_DATE: Date campaign sampling began (mandatory) CAMPAIGN_END_DATE: Date campaign sampling ended (optional) ORGANISATION: Organisation responsible campaign (mandatory) ENTERED_BY: Person entity entered data (mandatory) ENTERED_DATE: Date data entered system (mandatory) CAMPAIGN_COMMENT: Additional notes comments campaign (optional) See vignette("campaign-data") information.

title: Initialise compartments tibble — initialise_compartments_tibble
text: Creates empty tibble standardised column structure environmental compartment data.

title: Initialise compartments tibble — initialise_compartments_tibble
text: tibble 0 rows standardised compartment columns

title: Initialise compartments tibble — initialise_compartments_tibble
text: Compartments define environmental matrix measurement context sampling activities. compartments table direct output eData format used construct samples table. tibble includes following columns: ENVIRON_COMPARTMENT: Broad environmental compartment (Aquatic, Atmospheric, Terrestrial, Biota) ENVIRON_COMPARTMENT_SUB: Specific sub-category within compartment MEASURED_CATEGORY: Measurement context (External Media, Internal Organism, Surface Organism)

title: Initialise measurements tibble — initialise_measurements_tibble
text: Creates empty tibble standardised column structure measurements data.

title: Initialise measurements tibble — initialise_measurements_tibble
text: tibble 0 rows standardised measurement columns

title: Initialise measurements tibble — initialise_measurements_tibble
text: Measurements represent quantitative observations combining sample, compartment, biota information analytical results quality metrics. tibble includes following columns: SITE_CODE: Code identifying sampling location PARAMETER_NAME: Name measured parameter (Foreign key) SAMPLING_DATE: Date sample collection ENVIRON_COMPARTMENT_SUB: Specific environmental sub-compartment SUBSAMPLE: Subsample identifier MEASURED_FLAG: Quality flag measurement (e.g., < LOQ, < LOD) MEASURED_VALUE: Numeric value measurement UNCERTAINTY_TYPE: Type uncertainty variability metric UNCERTAINTY_UPPER: Upper bound uncertainty UNCERTAINTY_LOWER: Lower bound uncertainty MEASURED_UNIT: Unit measurement MEASURED_N: Number replicates observations LOQ_VALUE: Limit quantification value LOQ_UNIT: Unit limit quantification LOD_VALUE: Limit detection value LOD_UNIT: Unit limit detection SAMPLING_PROTOCOL: Protocol used sample collection (Foreign key) EXTRACTION_PROTOCOL: Protocol used sample extraction (Foreign key) FRACTIONATION_PROTOCOL: Protocol used sample fractionation (Foreign key) ANALYTICAL_PROTOCOL: Protocol used analysis (Foreign key) REFERENCE_ID: Reference identifier data source (Foreign key) SAMPLE_ID: Unique sample identifier CAMPAIGN_NAME_SHORT: Short name associated campaign ENVIRON_COMPARTMENT: Broad environmental compartment PARAMETER_TYPE: Classification parameter MEASURED_TYPE: Type measurement MEASUREMENT_COMMENT: Additional notes measurement

title: Initialise methods tibble — initialise_methods_tibble
text: Creates empty tibble standardised column structure analytical methods data.

title: Initialise methods tibble — initialise_methods_tibble
text: tibble 0 rows standardised methods columns

title: Initialise methods tibble — initialise_methods_tibble
text: Methods describe protocols used sampling, extraction, fractionation, analysis procedures. tibble includes following columns: PROTOCOL_ID: Unique identifier protocol (Primary Key) CAMPAIGN_NAME: Name campaign protocol used PROTOCOL_CATEGORY: Type protocol (Sampling, Extraction, Fractionation, Analytical) PROTOCOL_NAME: Standardised name protocol PROTOCOL_COMMENT: Additional notes details protocol

title: Initialise parameters tibble — initialise_parameters_tibble
text: Creates empty tibble standardised column structure parameter data.

title: Initialise parameters tibble — initialise_parameters_tibble
text: tibble 0 rows standardised parameter columns

title: Initialise parameters tibble — initialise_parameters_tibble
text: Parameters define chemical substances, physical properties, biological markers measured, including classification chemical identifiers. tibble includes following columns: PARAMETER_TYPE: Broad classification (Stressor, Quality parameter, Normalisation, etc.) PARAMETER_TYPE_SUB: Sub-classification providing specific categorisation MEASURED_TYPE: Type measurement (Concentration, Dose, Physical parameter, etc.) PARAMETER_NAME: Standardised name parameter (Primary Key) PARAMETER_NAME_SUB: Additional specification variant parameter name INCHIKEY_SD: InChIKey identifier chemical substances PUBCHEM_CID: PubChem Compound Identifier CAS_RN: Chemical Abstracts Service Registry Number ENTERED_BY: Person entity entered parameter PARAMETER_COMMENT: Additional notes parameter

title: Initialise references tibble — initialise_references_tibble
text: Creates empty tibble standardised column structure reference data.

title: Initialise references tibble — initialise_references_tibble
text: tibble 0 rows standardised reference columns

title: Initialise references tibble — initialise_references_tibble
text: References provide bibliographic information data sources including journals, reports, datasets, published materials. tibble includes following columns: REFERENCE_ID: Unique identifier reference (Primary Key) REFERENCE_TYPE: Type publication (Journal Article, Report, Dataset, etc.) DATA_SOURCE: Source database reference obtained AUTHOR: Author(s) reference TITLE: Title publication document YEAR: Publication year ACCESS_DATE: Date reference accessed retrieved PERIODICAL_JOURNAL: Name journal periodical VOLUME: Volume number journal ISSUE: Issue number journal PUBLISHER: Publisher document INSTITUTION: Institution associated publication DOI: Digital Object Identifier URL: Web address online access ISBN_ISSN: ISBN ISSN identifier EDITION: Edition publication DOCUMENT_NUMBER: Document report number REF_COMMENT: Additional notes reference

title: Initialise samples tibble — initialise_samples_tibble
text: Creates empty tibble standardised column structure sample data.

title: Initialise samples tibble — initialise_samples_tibble
text: tibble 0 rows standardised sample columns

title: Initialise samples tibble — initialise_samples_tibble
text: Samples represent individual collections sites temporal, spatial, methodological information linking sites, parameters, compartments. tibble includes following columns: SITE_CODE: Code identifying sampling location SITE_NAME: Descriptive name sampling site PARAMETER_NAME: Name measured parameter PARAMETER_TYPE: Classification parameter ENVIRON_COMPARTMENT: Environmental compartment defined one earth's spheres (aquatic, atmospheric, etc.) ENVIRON_COMPARTMENT_SUB: Sub-divisions environmental compartments water body types, soil profile, etc. MEASURED_CATEGORY: Measurement context category SAMPLING_DATE: Date sample collection SUBSAMPLE: Subsample replicate identifier SUBSAMPLE_ID: Unique identifier subsample SAMPLE_ID: Unique identifier sample (Key)

title: Initialise sites tibble — initialise_sites_tibble
text: Creates empty tibble standardised column structure site data.

title: Initialise sites tibble — initialise_sites_tibble
text: tibble 0 rows standardised site columns

title: Initialise sites tibble — initialise_sites_tibble
text: Sites represent sampling locations geographic coordinates, administrative boundaries, descriptive metadata sampling location. tibble includes following columns: SITE_CODE: Unique code identifying site (Primary Key) SITE_NAME: Descriptive name sampling site SITE_GEOGRAPHIC_FEATURE: Broad geographic feature type SITE_GEOGRAPHIC_FEATURE_SUB: Specific sub-category geographic feature COUNTRY_ISO: ISO country code site located OCEAN_IHO: International Hydrographic Organisation ocean region LATITUDE: Latitude coordinate decimal degrees LONGITUDE: Longitude coordinate decimal degrees SITE_COORDINATE_SYSTEM: Coordinate reference system used ALTITUDE_VALUE: Elevation depth value ALTITUDE_UNIT: Unit measurement altitude ENTERED_BY: Person entity entered site data ENTERED_DATE: Date site data entered SITE_COMMENT: Additional notes site

what: Parameter units and conversion factors vocabulary — parameter_unit_vocabulary
title: Parameter units and conversion factors vocabulary — parameter_unit_vocabulary
text: Returns unit definitions SI conversion factors environmental measurements.

title: Parameter units and conversion factors vocabulary — parameter_unit_vocabulary
Parameter units and conversion factors vocabulary — parameter_unit_vocabulary
text: select_column Optional column name extract: "MEASURED_UNIT", "BASE_SI_UNIT", "CONVERSION_FACTOR", "UNIT_COMMENTS"

title: Parameter units and conversion factors vocabulary — parameter_unit_vocabulary
text: dataframe (select_column NULL) character vector (column specified)

title: Parameter units and conversion factors vocabulary — parameter_unit_vocabulary
text: Reads unit conversion data unit_conversion_factors.csv containing standardised units ecotoxicological environmental measurements. complete dataset includes columns: MEASURED_UNIT: Unit recorded measurements BASE_SI_UNIT: Corresponding SI base unit CONVERSION_FACTOR: Numeric factor convert SI units UNIT_COMMENTS: Additional notes unit usage conversion Data source: extdata/unit_conversion_factors.csv

text: character vector protocol category options

title: Protocol categories controlled vocabulary — protocol_categories_vocabulary

title: All protocols controlled vocabulary — protocol_options_vocabulary
text: Returns combined protocol options protocol categories.

title: All protocols controlled vocabulary — protocol_options_vocabulary
text: tibble Protocol_Type, Short_Name, Long_Name columns protocols

title: All protocols controlled vocabulary — protocol_options_vocabulary
text: Combines protocol vocabularies (sampling, fractionation, extraction, analytical) single comprehensive tibble. Contains columns: Protocol_Type: Category protocol (Sampling, Fractionation, Extraction, Analytical Protocol) Short_Name: Abbreviated protocol name Long_Name: Full descriptive protocol name function aggregates results sampling_protocols_vocabulary(), fractionation_protocols_vocabulary(), extraction_protocols_vocabulary(), analytical_protocols_vocabulary().

title: Reference field character limits — reference_character_limits
text: Returns maximum character lengths text fields references table.

title: Reference field character limits — reference_character_limits
text: named list character limits reference fields

title: Reference field character limits — reference_character_limits
text: Provides named list character limits reference metadata fields ensure data quality database compatibility. Limits include: DOCUMENT_NUMBER: 200 characters DOI: 200 characters EDITION: 200 characters INSTITUTION: 200 characters ISBN_ISSN: 200 characters PERIODICAL_JOURNAL: 200 characters PUBLISHER: 200 characters REF_COMMENT: 1000 characters URL: 200 characters

title: Sampling protocols controlled vocabulary — sampling_protocols_vocabulary
text: Returns sampling protocol options short long names.

title: Sampling protocols controlled vocabulary — sampling_protocols_vocabulary
text: tibble Protocol_Type, Short_Name, Long_Name columns

title: Sampling protocols controlled vocabulary — sampling_protocols_vocabulary
text: Provides standardised sampling method classifications tibble three columns: Protocol_Type: Always "Sampling Protocol" Short_Name: Abbreviated protocol name (e.g., "Point", "Composite", "Trawl") Long_Name: Full descriptive name (e.g., "Point sampling", "Composite sampling", "Trawl sampling") Available protocols include: relevant, reported, Point, Composite, Trawl, Grab, Core, Seine net, Electrofishing, Plankton net, Bailer, Peristaltic pump, Active air, Passive air, SPMD, SPE, LVSPE, DGT, Caged organisms, Blood sample, Biopsy,

title: Species groups controlled vocabulary — species_groups_vocabulary
text: character vector species group options

title: Species groups controlled vocabulary — species_groups_vocabulary
text: Provides high-level taxonomic groupings used ECOTOX database. Options include: Algae Amphibians Bacteria Birds Crustaceans Ecosystem Fish Fungi Insects/Spiders Invertebrates Mammals Molluscs Moss/Hornworts Plants Reptiles Worms

title: Species names controlled vocabulary — species_names_vocabulary
text: Returns species information EPA ECOTOX database.

title: Species names controlled vocabulary — species_names_vocabulary
text: data frame species information

title: Species names controlled vocabulary — species_names_vocabulary
text: Provides comprehensive species data including common names, scientific names, kingdom, species group classifications. Data read ecotox_2025_06_12_species.parquet includes following columns: SPECIES_COMMON_NAME: Common vernacular name SPECIES_NAME: Scientific (Latin) name SPECIES_KINGDOM: Taxonomic kingdom (used format) SPECIES_GROUP: Broad taxonomic grouping Additional entries "" "Ecosystem" included. Data source: extdata/ecotox_2025_06_12_species.parquet

title: Tissue types controlled vocabulary — tissue_types_vocabulary
text: Provides standardised categories biological tissues sampled organisms. Options include: reported relevant Whole body Total soft tissues Muscle Liver Kidney Fat/Adipose Skin Bone Pyloric caeca Body wall Brain Heart Lung Gill Gonad Shell Carapace Digestive Gland Mantle Blood Egg Larva Leaf Root Stem Fruit Seed future, standardised BRENDA /Uberon tissue ontologies.

title: Uncertainty types controlled vocabulary — uncertainty_types_vocabulary
text: Returns controlled vocabulary options statistical uncertainty variability measures.

title: Uncertainty types controlled vocabulary — uncertainty_types_vocabulary
text: character vector uncertainty type options

title: Uncertainty types controlled vocabulary — uncertainty_types_vocabulary
text: Provides standardised categories expressing measurement uncertainty commonly found scientific literature databases. Options include: Reported Relevant Arithmetic Mean Geometric Mean Standard Deviation Standard Error 95% Confidence Interval 90% Confidence Interval 99% Confidence Interval Min-Max Range Interquartile Range (Q1-Q3) 10th-90th Percentile 5th-95th Percentile Coefficient Variation (%) Median Absolute Deviation First-Third Quartile Range Minimum-Maximum Variance Standard Error Mean Relative Standard Deviation (%) 95% Credible Interval 95% Prediction Interval 95% Tolerance Interval 95% Bootstrap CI
